units.title: Dataset curation
units.text: We curated all neural organoid datasets used in this study through the sfaira78 framework (GitHub dev branch, 18 April 2023).
units.rationale: Describes the initial collection of datasets.

units.title: Metadata harmonization
units.text: We harmonized metadata according to the sfaira standards (https://sfaira.readthedocs.io/en/latest/adding_datasets.html) and manually curated an extra metadata column organoid_age_days, which described the number of days the organoid had been in culture before collection.

units.title: Removal of non‑applicable subsets
units.text: We next removed any non-applicable subsets of the published datasets: diseased samples or samples expressing disease-associated mutations (refs. 14–16,18,19,26), fused organoids (ref. 1), primary fetal data (refs. 10,23), hormone-treated samples (ref. 22), data collected before neural induction (refs. 3,20) and share-seq data (ref. 23).
units.rationale: Filters out data that could confound the analysis.

units.title: Cell‑type hierarchy construction
units.text: We constructed a hierarchy of cell types including progenitor, neuron and non-neural types, each defined by a set of marker genes (Supplementary Data 1).
units.rationale: Creates a reference framework for annotation.

units.title: RSS‑based expression profiling
units.text: We represented the data by the RSS3 to average expression profiles of cell clusters in the recently published human developing brain cell atlas27.
units.rationale: Maps organoid data onto a reference atlas.

units.title: kNN graph and Leiden clustering
units.text: We then constructed a kNN graph (k = 30) in the RSS space and clustered the dataset using the Leiden algorithm83 (resolution 80).

units.title: Gene‑count filtering
units.text: We removed any cells with fewer than 200 genes expressed.

units.title: Outlier removal based on QC metrics
units.text: We removed outlier cells in terms of two quality control metrics: number of expressed genes and percentage mitochondrial counts.
units.rationale: Further cleans the dataset by QC thresholds.

units.title: Log‑normalization of counts
units.text: We next generated a log-normalized expression matrix by first dividing the counts for each cell by the total counts in that cell and multiplying by a factor of 1,000,000 before taking the natural log of each count + 1.
units.rationale: Prepares data for downstream statistical analysis.

units.title: Selection of highly variable genes
units.text: We computed 3,000 highly variable features in a batch-aware manner using the scanpy highly_variable_genes function (flavor = ‘seurat_v3’, batch_key = ‘bio_sample’).
units.rationale: Identifies informative genes for dimensionality reduction.
